newsitem.title: USA: Intuit, Microsoft, CheckFree set Internet standard.
newsitem.headline: Intuit, Microsoft, CheckFree set Internet standard.

text.p: Microsoft Corp., Intuit Inc., and CheckFree Corp. Thursday unveiled a unified standard that will let financial institutions exchange financial data over the Internet.
The so-called "Open Financial Exchange" will create a common platform for electronic banking for banks that want to offer home banking to customers.
This will allow a direct link over the Internet between consumers, using Intuit's Quicken or Microsoft's Money personal finance software, and their financial institutions.
The companies said the creation of a unified standard will accelerate the adoption of electronic financial networks.
The companies said they were working with Visa Interactive to link the Open Financial Exchange to Visa's ADMS bill paying network.

The companies said the exchange will support banking activities such as consumer and small business bill payment and investments including stocks and bonds. They said they plan to add other financial services, including financial planning and tax preparation and filing.
